title: Fraud Detection Guidelines
chunks: Multiple transactions from different countries within a short time frame indicate potential fraud.
Velocity checks: More than 5 transactions in an hour or more than $5000 in a day should trigger alerts.
Device changes coupled with high-value transactions are strong fraud indicators.

title: Customer Verification Procedures
chunks: Always verify customer identity through two-factor authentication for high-risk transactions.
Contact customer via registered phone number for transactions over $1000 from new devices.
Require additional verification for international transactions from first-time locations.
VIP customers should have expedited verification processes with dedicated support.

title: Card Freeze Protocols
chunks: Immediate card freeze is recommended for confirmed fraud or customer request.
Temporary freeze can be applied for suspicious activity pending investigation.
Customer must be notified within 5 minutes of any card freeze action.
Unfreezing requires customer authentication and reason documentation.

title: Dispute Resolution Process
chunks: All disputes must be acknowledged within 24 hours of submission.
Provisional credit should be issued within 2 business days for amounts under $500.
Investigation timeline: 10 business days for domestic, 20 for international transactions.
Customer must provide supporting documentation for disputes over $1000.
